info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Missoula County through 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Alberton, or 15 miles west of Missoula, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Wye, Frenchtown and Huson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near mile marker 78, and between mile markers 81 and 99. Highway 93 between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
